# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in A# (Shape: E)

## Description
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in a succession, rather than simultaneously. In this specific case, we are looking at a Minor 6th arpeggio in the key of A# (A# minor 6th arpeggio).

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in the A# minor 6th arpeggio are A# (root), C# (minor 3rd), E# (5th), and F# (6th). The intervals between the notes in this arpeggio are a minor 3rd, major 3rd, and minor 3rd.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 6th arpeggio is commonly used in various genres including jazz, fusion, and progressive rock. It adds a melancholic and jazzy flavor to the music, often providing an emotional and introspective sound.
